required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prevalence of Oral Mucosal Alterations in Mucocutaneous Ocular Disorders
clinical_study.official_title: Prevalence of Oral Mucosal Alterations in a Sample of Egyptian Patients With Mucocutaneous Ocular Disorders: A Hospital Based Cross Sectional Study

brief_summary.textblock: The patients will be selected from the pool of the Clinics (Rheumatology, Ophthalmology and Dermatology) of Faculty of Medicine and (Diagnostic center and Oral Medicine) of Faculty of Dentistry -Cairo University. For each eligible participant, a full history will be obtained followed by thorough clinical examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Identifying and recording oral mucosal alterations
primary_outcome.description: clinical examination according to World Health Organization guidelines

secondary_outcome.measure: Identifying the oral health-related quality of life: OHIP-14
secondary_outcome.description: using Oral Health Impact Profile-14 (OHIP-14) Slade G. and Spencer A.: Development and evolution of the oral health impact profile. Community Dent Health, 11 (1): 3-11, 1994 Response categories for the five-point scale are: "Very often", "Fairly often", "Occasionally", "Hardly ever" and "Never".

study_pop.textblock: A convenience sample of adult patients diagnosed with mucocutanous oculer disorders attending to Clinics (Rheumatology, Ophthalmology and Dermatology) of Faculty of Medicine and (Diagnostic center and Oral Medicine) of Faculty of Dentistry -Cairo University will be enrolled in the study in a consecutive order.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients diagnosed with one of the mucocutaneous disorder.
- Patient who will agree to participate in the study.
- Patients who will accept to sign the informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients not physically able to participate in survey or clinical oral examination.

overall_contact.last_name: sherin alaa eldin eisa elsayed, BDS
